2.text: Truly ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you!

3.text: I also have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you; and who knoweth not such things as these?

4.text: I am to be one that is a derision to his friend, I who call upon +God, and whom he will answer: a derision is the just upright [man].

5.text: He that is ready to stumble with the foot is a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.

6.text: The tents of desolators are in peace, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand +God bringeth.

7.text: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowl of the heavens, and they shall tell thee;

8.text: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee; and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.

9.text: Who knoweth not in all these, that the hand of Jehovah hath wrought this?

10.text: In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the spirit of all flesh of man.

11.text: Doth not the ear try words, as the palate tasteth food?

12.text: With the aged is wisdom, and in length of days understanding.

13.text: With him is wisdom and might; he hath counsel and understanding.

14.text: Behold, he breaketh down, and it is not built again; he shutteth up a man, and there is no opening.

15.text: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up; and he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.

16.text: With him is strength and effectual knowledge; the deceived and the deceiver are his.

17.text: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and judges maketh he fools;

18.text: He weakeneth the government of kings, and bindeth their loins with a fetter;

19.text: He leadeth priests away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty;

20.text: He depriveth of speech the trusty, and taketh away the judgment of the elders;

21.text: He poureth contempt upon nobles, and slackeneth the girdle of the mighty;

22.text: He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out into light the shadow of death;

23.text: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them; he spreadeth out the nations, and bringeth them in;

24.text: He taketh away the understanding of the chiefs of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a pathless waste.

25.text: They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like a drunkard.
